snippet: Advisers and better intelligence could improve United States air power in an effort to assist the Nuri Kamal al-Maliki government.
abstract: Military analysis; current and former American military officials say American air power could play important role in reversing Sunni insurgent offensive in Iraq; Pres Obama is considering airstrikes among a range of options to help Prime Min Nuri Kamal-al-Maliki's government.

byline.original: By MICHAEL R. GORDON and HELENE COOPER

lead_paragraph: Advisers and better intelligence could improve United States air power in an effort to assist the Nuri Kamal al-Maliki government.

headline.main: U.S. Airstrikes Could Help in Reversing Insurgent Offensive, Experts Say
headline.print_headline: U.S. Airstrikes Could Help in Reversing Insurgent Offensive, Experts Say
